I love your style. I’m a really big fan of your Angular breeze courses on PluralSight. I decided to build an application using your approach and I have a question. I’m trying to get to inject a service with the config.route.js file and i’m running to a ton of issues nothing seems to work. I tried the following to no avail. Normal dependency injection while in a controller works fine.

First attempt:

function getUserInfo() {
    var $injector = angular.injector(['ng']);
    var storage = $injector.get('webStorage');
    TkprIndex = storage.get('userInfo').[0]tkprIndex;
    return TkprIndex;
}

Error: Uncaught Error: [$injector:unpr] Unknown provider: webStorageProvider <- webStorage

Second attempt:

getUserInfo.$inject = [&#039;webStorage&#039;];
function getUserInfo(storage) { return storage.get(&#039;userInfo&#039;); }
